channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: There are good military leaders & not-so-good ones, says Jaishankar. Why is Pakistan fuming?
IndiGo crisis: Why are flights still being cancelled? When will normal ops resume?
Why is Vande Mataram being debated in Parliament, 150 years after it was first penned?
How does Cambodia's army stack up against Thailand?
10 coups in 5 years: The troubled past and present of Africa
Heathrow ‘pepper spray' assault: What happened, who was behind attack that left 21 injured?
How Taliban’s plan to dam Kabul-Kunar basin will squeeze water-stressed Pakistan further
item.description: The proposed Kunar-Panjshir and other Kabul basin projects effectively turns the Kabul River into an extension of South Asia’s broader water competition

item.title: How Prof Yunus is teaching fascism in Bangladeshi universities
item.description: Muhammad Yunus’s administration has lodged a systematic war against students, teachers, and officials who hold views even slightly divergent from the regime’s preferred ideological order

item.title: India’s Brics presidency and US chairing G20 will test New Delhi’s diplomatic balancing in 2026
item.description: India’s approach is pragmatic, not doctrinal: work with whoever is necessary to achieve outcomes. In 2026, this pragmatism will be tested as India balances expectations across very different tables

item.title: New report, old realities: Balochistan remains under Pakistan’s brutal siege
item.description: Violence in Balochistan is not incidental; it is systemic, structured, and historically produced

item.title: Khairabad: The mini-Lucknow built by a Nawab’s tailor
item.description: Today, the stunning set of buildings that stands in Khairabad, about 80 kilometres from Lucknow, is the result of Makka Darzee’s post-retirement work, emulating the architecture and style of Nawabs of Awadh

item.title: Putin’s visit shows India-Russia ties can shape a multipolar world beyond the US-China duopoly
item.description: Within the India-Russia bilateral is the real play of a multipolar world order. Both countries know the depth of their bilateral can survive the savagely changing winds of contemporary geopolitical reality
